p: Diverse studies have reported that edible mushrooms possess bioactive compounds that enhance various antioxidant enzymes in the body [ 1]. Over the past decade, H. erinaceus has attracted increasing attention in the fields of functional foods and biomedicine. Numerous studies have reported the potential medicinal values or health-beneficial activities of this mushroom, like anti-cancer, anti-hypertensive, hypolipidemic, and neuronal disease protecting activities [ 1, 11]. This study also established a good relationship between radical scavenging activity and phenolic/flavonoid compounds, thus suggesting a potential neuroprotective effect in AD.
